board

Class Components

  • java.lang.Object
    • board.Components
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Components
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Contains the lists of components on the board.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Alfons Wirtz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Adds a component to this object.

      Inserts a component into the list.
      void change_side(int p_component_no, IntPoint p_pole)
      Changes the placement side of the component the component with numberp_component_no and mirrors it at the vertical line through p_pole.
      int count()
      Returns the number of components on the board.
      void generate_snapshot()
      Generates a snapshot for the undo algorithm.
      boolean get_flip_style_rotate_first()
      If true, components on the back side are rotated before mirroring, else they are mirrored before rotating.

      Returns the component with the input component number or null, if no such component exists.

      Returns the component with the input name or null, if no such component exists.

      Moves the component with number p_component_no.
      boolean redo(BoardObservers p_observers)
      Restores the sitiation before the last undo.
      void rotate(int p_component_no, double p_rotation_in_degree, IntPoint p_pole)
      Rotates the component with number p_component_no by p_rotation_in_degree around p_pole.
      void set_flip_style_rotate_first(boolean p_value)
      If true, components on the back side are rotated before mirroring, else they are mirrored before rotating.
      void turn_90_degree(int p_component_no, int p_factor, IntPoint p_pole)
      Turns the component with number p_component_no by p_factor times 90 degree around p_pole.
      boolean undo(BoardObservers p_observers)
      Restores the sitiation at the previous snapshot.

        public Components()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public Component add(java.lang.String p_name,
                     Point p_location,
                     double p_rotation_in_degree,
                     boolean p_on_front,
                     Package p_package_front,
                     Package p_package_back,
                     boolean p_position_fixed)
        Inserts a component into the list. The items of the component have to be inserted seperately into the board. If p_on_front is false, the component will be placed on the back side, and p_package_back is used instead of p_package_front.
        Parameters:
        p_name - a String object.
        p_location - a Point object.
        p_rotation_in_degree - a double.
        p_on_front - a boolean.
        p_package_front - a Package object.
        p_package_back - a Package object.
        p_position_fixed - a boolean.
        Returns:
        a Component object.

      • add

        public Component add(Point p_location,
                     double p_rotation,
                     boolean p_on_front,
                     Package p_package)
        Adds a component to this object. The items of the component have to be inserted seperately into the board. If p_on_front is false, the component will be placed on the back side. The component name is generated internally.
        Parameters:
        p_location - a Point object.
        p_rotation - a double.
        p_on_front - a boolean.
        p_package - a Package object.
        Returns:
        a Component object.

      • get

        public Component get(java.lang.String p_name)
        Returns the component with the input name or null, if no such component exists.
        Parameters:
        p_name - a String object.
        Returns:
        a Component object.

      • get

        public Component get(int p_component_no)
        Returns the component with the input component number or null, if no such component exists. Component numbers are from 1 to component count
        Parameters:
        p_component_no - a int.
        Returns:
        a Component object.

      • count

        public int count()
        Returns the number of components on the board.
        Returns:
        a int.

      • generate_snapshot

        public void generate_snapshot()
        Generates a snapshot for the undo algorithm.

      • undo

        public boolean undo(BoardObservers p_observers)
        Restores the sitiation at the previous snapshot. Returns false, if no more undo is possible.
        Parameters:
        p_observers - a BoardObservers object.
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • redo

        public boolean redo(BoardObservers p_observers)
        Restores the sitiation before the last undo. Returns false, if no more redo is possible.
        Parameters:
        p_observers - a BoardObservers object.
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • move

        public void move(int p_component_no,
                 Vector p_vector)
        Moves the component with number p_component_no. Works contrary to Component.translate_by with the undo algorithm of the board.
        Parameters:
        p_component_no - a int.
        p_vector - a Vector object.

      • turn_90_degree

        public void turn_90_degree(int p_component_no,
                           int p_factor,
                           IntPoint p_pole)
        Turns the component with number p_component_no by p_factor times 90 degree around p_pole. Works contrary to Component.turn_90_degree with the undo algorithm of the board.
        Parameters:
        p_component_no - a int.
        p_factor - a int.
        p_pole - a IntPoint object.

      • rotate

        public void rotate(int p_component_no,
                   double p_rotation_in_degree,
                   IntPoint p_pole)
        Rotates the component with number p_component_no by p_rotation_in_degree around p_pole. Works contrary to Component.rotate with the undo algorithm of the board.
        Parameters:
        p_component_no - a int.
        p_rotation_in_degree - a double.
        p_pole - a IntPoint object.

      • change_side

        public void change_side(int p_component_no,
                        IntPoint p_pole)
        Changes the placement side of the component the component with numberp_component_no and mirrors it at the vertical line through p_pole. Works contrary to Component.change_side the undo algorithm of the board.
        Parameters:
        p_component_no - a int.
        p_pole - a IntPoint object.

      • set_flip_style_rotate_first

        public void set_flip_style_rotate_first(boolean p_value)
        If true, components on the back side are rotated before mirroring, else they are mirrored before rotating.
        Parameters:
        p_value - a boolean.

      • get_flip_style_rotate_first

        public boolean get_flip_style_rotate_first()
        If true, components on the back side are rotated before mirroring, else they are mirrored before rotating.
        Returns:
        a boolean.
